transcript.title: AUSTRALIAN PUBLIC SERVICE INTERCHANGE PROGRAMME - 6 OCTOBER 1977
transcript.content:
1j) A S ALI( LL
FOR PRESS 6 OCTOBER 1977
AUSTRALIAN PUBLIC SERVICE INTERCHANGE PROGRAMME
The Public Service Board has introduced an Interchange:
Programme aimed at fostering mobility in the Public Service
through arrangements such as secondments and exchanges.
This follows the Board's introduction late last year of
an Executive Development Scheme through which some twenty
officers have been placed in work assignments in other
departments, public services and the private sector.
The introduc-tion-o-f the-Interchange Programme by the Board
is in line with the views of the Royal Commission on
Australian Government Administration. The Programme
will involve exchanges, secondmnents and transfers of staff
between the public and private sectors and between departments
within the Australian Public Service.
To support the Programme the Chairman of the Board is
meeting with various leaders in the community to promote
exchanges and discuss possible placements.
The Government is actively supporting the Board in its
fostering of staff exchanges believing that they are an
important way of increasing mutual understanding and
communication between different organisations allowing a
sharing of expertise throughout the community and of contributing
to the career development of those involved.
The introduction of the Interchange Programme is an important,%
positive and valuable step in improving understanding and
extending communications between the sectors of Australian society.
